[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event ordering] Does MoveEventV2Type guarantee deterministic event ordering across validators, or can race conditions cause different validators to process burn events in different orders? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event authentication] Can malicious actors emit Burn events outside the legitimate token::burn flow by exploiting the MoveEventV2Type trait implementation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Serialization determinism] Does BCS serialization of the Burn struct produce identical byte sequences across all validators for the same field values, or can endianness or platform differences cause divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Round-trip consistency] Can try_from_bytes(bcs::to_bytes(burn)) fail to produce an equivalent Burn instance, causing event processing inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Field ordering] Does BCS serialization depend on the Rust struct field declaration order, or could compiler reordering cause serialization incompatibilities across compiler versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Supply decrement] When Burn events are emitted, can they be processed before the actual supply decrement in FixedSupply/UnlimitedSupply/ConcurrentSupply, causing temporary supply inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Index correlation] Can the index field in Burn events become desynchronized from the actual token indices in collections, allowing supply manipulation through fake burn events with arbitrary indices? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Concurrent burns] If multiple tokens are burned concurrently in the same transaction, can Burn events be emitted out-of-order or with duplicate indices causing supply tracking corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Supply underflow] Can Burn events be emitted when current_supply is already 0, causing integer underflow in supply tracking and wrapping to u64::MAX? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Cross-collection attacks] Can an attacker create Burn events claiming a token belongs to collection A when it actually belongs to collection B, manipulating multiple collection supplies simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Token existence] Are Burn events validated to only reference tokens that actually existed at the time of burning, or can events be created for never-minted tokens? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Collection authority] Can Burn events be emitted without proper collection authority checks, allowing unauthorized parties to forge burn events affecting collection statistics? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: previous_owner] [Ownership proof] Is previous_owner verified against on-chain ownership records before event emission, or can attackers claim false previous ownership for fraud or market manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: previous_owner] [Ownership history] Can Burn events overwrite or contradict previous ownership history, allowing attackers to rewrite NFT provenance data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: previous_owner] [Transfer validation] If a token is transferred immediately before burning, can the previous_owner field contain stale data from before the transfer, causing incorrect ownership tracking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: previous_owner] [Zero address] Can previous_owner be set to the zero address (0x0) for tokens burned immediately after minting, causing issues in systems that track owner histories? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Event replay] Can the same Burn event be replayed multiple times by re-emitting identical event data, causing supply tracking to decrement multiple times for a single burn? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Transaction replay] If a burn transaction is replayed (despite sequence number checks), can duplicate Burn events be emitted causing state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Idempotency] Is there any mechanism to ensure burn operations are idempotent, preventing double-processing of Burn events in retry scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Migration consistency] During the module_event_migration feature flag transition, can some validators emit V2 Burn events while others emit V1 BurnEvent, causing consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Dual emission] Can both V1 BurnEvent and V2 Burn events be emitted for the same token burn, causing double-counting in supply tracking and analytics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Struct: Burn] [Feature flag bypass] Can attackers exploit the feature flag mechanism to force emission of Burn events in specific format to bypass monitoring or analysis tools? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: index] [Index exhaustion] Can the u64 index field reach u64::MAX in large collections, and what happens when trying to mint/burn additional tokens beyond this limit? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: index] [Index reuse] Can token indices be reused after burning, potentially causing confusion between historical burn events and new tokens with the same index? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/burn.rs] [Field: index] [Index gaps] If tokens are burned out of order, can index gaps in collections cause issues with iteration or supply calculations that assume contiguous indices? (Low)
